title: alfa_bet
shortInfo: Inspired by the shape of the window, interactive messaging system based on the façade of the Alfa building towers.
longInfo: After moving to a new studio on the eighth floor of an office building, location, the modular façade and characteristic window layout encouraged me to design the interactive messaging system.

I designed a typeface based on the construction of the window. Then created a prototype of the typo-panel in 1:4 scale based on the LED strips. The individual characters are displayed by a code running on the Arduino board.
Currently working on app that sends messages to the Arduino and displays them on the typo-panel.
tasks: design of the typeface based on the shape of the window
design and development of a typo-panel with LED strips
design and development of an app sending and displaying messages on the typo-panel

title: b o a a
shortInfo: Website for an Poland based and internationally operating young and slick architectural studio.
longInfo: Based on the visual identity I did earlier I am designing a website showing completed and in development projects as well as the studio and its founder.
Design is ready. Currently working on markup, styles, interactions and CMS setup.
tasks: basic user experience research and prototype
design of all the views and interactions

title: one two three
shortInfo: Simple web app, based on educational approach developed by Maria Montessori, helping children learn new words.
longInfo: The Three Period Lesson by Italian physician Maria Montessori is divided into three simple steps, so the language can be absorbed more easily.
On the basis of this method, I developed an application that helps parents prepare sets a new vocabulary and the kids learn new words quickly and efficiently.
Currently working on the app logic.
tasks: research supervised by Montessori Education methodology specialist
prototype for flow and logic testing
design of all the views, dedicated icons set and interactions

title: newspaper
shortInfo: Rebrand, redesign and new digital products design for a local newspaper Wiadomości Wrzsińskie.
longInfo: After 25 years of providing information and helping local community newspaper Wiadomości Wrzesińskie needed an update of its visual communication and digital strategy to maintain its position as a modern local information hub.
In order to ensure unified visual communications across all channels of content distribution, I proposed a new visual identity and strategy of new products development.

Relying on the new visual identity I refreshed the layout of the newspaper, designed a new website and mobile application, created micro-sites presenting new products as well as prepared animations for TV department.
tasks: local community and customer service research
design of a weekly newsletter, mobile app and new website

title: grupa
shortInfo: Brand and product design for an educational startup focused on providing simple tools for kids to learn and play.
longInfo: Beautiful and functional objects make learning a lot more tempting and fun. Keeping with this idea young startup Grupa Projekt decided to introduce new simple products to the oversaturated market.
Beyond the smiley visual identity and website I also designed their first educational tool: alphabet. The alphabet consists of 48 cards with letters covered with sensory coating.

title: b o a a
shortInfo: Brand strategy and design for an architectural studio known for its thoughtful space concepts.
longInfo: Human-centered and pure space build with natural materials that is the essence of the boaa's founder approach to architecture.

Logo build from solid and trustworthy blocks forming a studio name thanks to the space between them, simple type and colours as well as high quality uncoated papers form the basis of the visual identity system.
"Doors and windows are carved out to make a room: there nothing within, the room is useful. Thus, with something one gets advantage, while with nothing one gets usefulness." — Laozi

title: parking
shortInfo: Signage and wayfinding system for an underground parking space designed by ultra-architects.
longInfo: All buildings designed by the ultra-architects studio are characterized by true functionality and technological sophistication.
For a parking in one of their buildings I developed a dedicated typeface and visual communication system for the wayfinding scheme.
tasks: design of the symbols and graphic elements set

title: game
shortInfo: Board game based on the true story of the world known Września Children Strike in 1901.
longInfo: The Września Children Strike was a world known protests of Polish children and their parents against Germanization that started in the city of Września in 1901.

Due to the upcoming anniversary of the strike, Mayor of Września decided to create a product that was an attractive form of education about the events from 1901 for children. History and logic of the game have been developed by a group of historians and local regionalists.
The game consists of a dice and pawn, notebook, cards and a board which shows the street in front of the school at the time of school strike.

title: topography
shortInfo: Story about Polish landowners told through photographs showing the current state of their houses and land.
longInfo: At the end of World War II, because of the reforms passed in 1944 by the Polish Committee of National Liberation, landed gentry was eliminated as a social group and their estates confiscated.

In his album “Topography of silence” Waldemar Śliwczyński shows what remained. Both abandoned and falling apart as well as an still in used and refurbished buildings which are the only remnant of an important Polish national heritage.
The album is a solid black plate with embossed scattered typographic structure. Duotone photographs are printed on an excellent Phoenix Motion Xantur paper.

title: capital
shortInfo: Once the fighting city, now overjoyed with big investment – book for the 6th edition of the “Września Collection”.
longInfo: The “Września Collection” is an art project held by the Mayor of Września who, every year, invites one photographer to capture Września (and/or its environs) in photographs at his or her sole discretion.

“Capital” created by Katarzyna Majak is the 6th edition of the “Września Collection”. It consists of three complementary parts: pictures of young Września residents, photographic landscapes depicting the process of preparing the land for the construction of the Volkswagen factory to be built in Września and the photographic typology showing menial workers met on this site.

Majak tries to draw attention to the shift of values. Referring to the Ireneusz Zjeżdżałka “Bez Atelier” project reminds about the people fighting against Germanization. Showing Volkswagen's site and workers portraits notes the joy and great hope residents have for this investment.

The design of the book is raw and precious at the same time. The  solid block is covered with silver Pantone paint with silver foil coated edges. Various papers were used to emphasize the transition between the three parts of the photographic project.
